analyzed: theḥ apadāna  padu mukkhi pa vagga
translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽. The Chapter with Padumuttara

analyzed: ā kā sukkhipi yat thera apadāna
translated: . The Elder Ākāsukkhipiya’s Birth Story
“I saw the golden-hued Siddhattha,
walking along the high street,
and taking two water lilies,
I approached the bull of men.

analyzed: ekam ca puppham pādesu  buddhaseṭṭhassa nikkhipi
translated: I placed one flower at his feet,
and the other I held aloft,
and I threw it into the sky.
For ninety-four aeons,
I did not go to a bad rebirth,
this was the fruit of offering the flower.
Thirty-six aeons ago,
I was a lord of the earth,
called Antarāṭṭakara,
a powerful wheel-turning monarch.
I attained the four analytical knowledges,
and the eight liberations,
and realized the six supernormal knowledges.

original: kataṁ buddhassa sāsanaṁ”.🔽Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā ākāsukkhipiyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: katam buddhassa sāsana  ittham sudam āyasmai ākāsukkhipiyaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: I did the Buddha’s bidding.”🔽Thus the elder Ākāsukkhipiya recited these verses.
The Elder Ākāsukkhipiya’s Birth Story is the first.
